reviews.review_msg: Amber-Marie's teaching style hasn't changed much. I get that being a prof means that she expects a certain level of hard work from students. But, she is unfair in grading because she's not one to be clear in her lectures and seminars. She is rude to others who may not share the same perspective as hers.

Anne-Marie is OK. She knows her material. Objectively interesting topics. But the way she presents them is not so interesting. Dry lectures. Very disorganized. Changed the syllabus maybe around 5 times during the sem. Very broad and not specific. Take her if you're interested in the material. If not, someone else might be better!

Anne-Marie is a great teacher. She has a wealth of information to learn from so make the most of your time in class with her. She has a great sense of humour also which makes for a great learning environment.

She's okay as a professer, but the overall course is too much. There's an in-class essay question every week at the beginning of the lecture (marks). Although it is a writing intensive course, discussions in class seem to go by quick, leaving everything else as independent study. She's quite old so you have to get use to her style of teaching.

Terrible professor.  She has her favorites, but if you're not one of them, you're screwed.  If you want to leave SFU disillusioned about the value of post-secondary education (which might not be a bad thing), take a class with Anne-Marie.

Its a Writing intensive class! What were you expecting? Anne Marie is an awesome teacher. She is more than willing to help anybody that asks for it, and is open to and encourages ALL points of view. This is the second class I've taken with Anne-Marie and am looking forward to more!
For a 5 week course in the summer - ELEVEN TEXTBOOKS!!!!  The Odyssey was the easiest one!  DO NOT TAKE HER, unless you have nothing to do all day but read ELEVEN textbooks.
